A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This film is an absolute disgrace. Aside from the plot holes and general quibbles one could have with any imperfect film\, what makes this such a horrible work is that it is a betrayal and mockery of all that is great in Star Wars. The Jedi? Thrown to the curb. The Sith? Who cares. Compassionate\, fearless hero Luke? Nope; just a grumpy old man too depressed to get off his ass. Good and Evil? Beyond good and evil. Mystery? Nope; nothing matters. History and tradition? Kill the past. A noble fight for what is right and good and true? Save the camel-horse-sheep-llamas. Fearless fighters willing to give their lives for the good of others? Silly hot-head "flyboys".

I am sickened by this betrayal. I normally watch Star Wars movies\, even the ones that are not my favorites\, multiple times in the theater but I will not watch this one and I will most likely not watch Episode 9 unless the true fans hail it as the redeeming film we all hope it will be.

I really liked Force Awakens and Rogue One. Those were Star Wars movies. This is a heap of garbage.
